meanings.definition: The quality of being countable or enumerable.
meanings.sent1: The denumerability of the items in the store made inventory management easier.
meanings.sent2: Mathematicians use denumerability to classify sets based on their countability.
meanings.sent3: The denumerability of the cookies in the jar led to a fun counting game.
meanings.sent4: Her denumerability in organizing books was like a well-ordered library.
meanings.sent5: The denumerability of stars in the sky was a mesmerizing sight.

meanings.definition: The property of a set being able to be put into one-to-one correspondence with the set of natural numbers.
meanings.sent1: Understanding denumerability helps in grasping the concept of infinite sets.
meanings.sent2: The denumerability of prime numbers is a fascinating topic in number theory.
meanings.sent3: The denumerability of socks in the drawer made matching pairs a breeze.
meanings.sent4: Her denumerability in solving puzzles was like finding the missing piece.
meanings.sent5: The denumerability of trees in the forest created a beautiful pattern.
